Queue

Add Item
Remove Item
Peek
Clear
Code in Java 


 
    import java.util.*;  
    class TestCollection12{  
    public static void main(String args[]){  
    PriorityQueue queue=new PriorityQueue();  
    queue.add("Amit");  
    queue.add("Vijay");  
    queue.add("Karan");  
    queue.add("Jai");  
    queue.add("Rahul");  
    System.out.println("head:"+queue.element());  
    System.out.println("head:"+queue.peek());  
    System.out.println("iterating the queue elements:");  
    Iterator itr=queue.iterator();  
    while(itr.hasNext()){  
    System.out.println(itr.next());  
    }  
    queue.remove();  
    queue.poll();  
    System.out.println("after removing two elements:");  
    Iterator itr2=queue.iterator();  
    while(itr2.hasNext()){  
    System.out.println(itr2.next());  
    }  
    }  
    }
Time Complexity 
                        
                            The searching operation also takes a total time of O(N), as reaching any specific element isn't possible without popping the elements stored after it. 
                            Operations like insertion or deletion in a queue take constant time i.e., O(1)
Space Complexity 
                            Space Complexity of the queue:
                        Space complexity for each operation in a queue is O(1), as no extra space is required for any operation
                        Auxiliary Space: O(1)
